intro: Zosterophyllanthos simulans, commonly known as the coastal spirea, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are arranged in whorls around the stem, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is often found growing near the shoreline. Zosterophyllanthos simulans is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to tolerate salty coastal environments.
